result.execSummary:
The defendant Justine M Makovec was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Justine M Makovec is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Justine M Makovec was found guilty of Receiving Stolen Property (>$2500-$5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(bf).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Restitutioin ordered Joint/Several. Probation agent to make a restitution payment plan within the first 30 days. Plan to be submitted to the court within 60 days. All money collected to be applied toward restitution first before being applied toward costs and supervision fees.

Fines, costs, and restitution are due during term of supervision.  Court further orders 25% of prison wages to be applied toward Court-ordered financial obligations.  If defendant is released with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
Defendant to participate in drug and/or alcohol counseling and treatment deemed appropriate by DOC and to pay all costs of treatment

Court orders absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants.  
Not to possess or consume controlled substances or prescription medication w/out a valid prescription. All prescriptions to be kept in original containers. Agent to be informed of all prescribed medications.

Defendant to submit to random testing. 
Submit to DNA sample and pay surcharge

timeConds.notes: Defendant is granted privileges set forth in Wis Stats 303.08

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Justine M Makovec in court with attorney Jeremy J Guza.  Defendant in custody from Ozaukee Co Jail. Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State opposes any reduction in bail. Court denies bail motion. State files information. Counsel waives reading and enters not guilty plea.
